text: Ronald Christopher Edwards (27 January 1931 - 28 November 1994), known as Buster Edwards, was a British career criminal. He was born in Lambeth, London. He was a member of the gang of the Great Train Robbery. He had also been a boxer and nightclub owner. Edwards was in prison for nine years. == Death == Edwards died after hanging himself (suicide) in Lambeth, at the age of 63.Train robber Edwards is found hanged, The Independent, 30 November 1994 His cause of death is still disputed because many people thought he was too drunk to have chosen to kill himself.Buster Edwards `too drunk' to have committed suicide, The Independent, 10 February 1995 A biopic, Buster, was released in 1988. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Criminals from London Category:Great Train Robbers Category:Suicides by hanging in the United Kingdom Category:People from the London Borough of Lambeth
